meanings.definition: Having a series of rounded projections along an edge or surface.
meanings.sent1: The crenulated castle walls looked like a row of small rounded bumps.
meanings.sent2: The crenulated design on the cake added a unique texture to it.
meanings.sent3: The crenulated pattern on the fabric made it look like tiny hills.
meanings.sent4: Her crenulated hairband gave her a regal appearance.
meanings.sent5: The crenulated border on the invitation card felt elegant to the touch.

meanings.definition: To form a series of rounded projections along an edge or surface.
meanings.sent1: She carefully crenulated the paper edges to create a decorative effect.
meanings.sent2: The artist crenulated the clay to give it a textured finish.
meanings.sent3: He crenulated the sandcastle edges, making them resemble a miniature fortress.
meanings.sent4: The chef crenulated the pie crust, making it visually appealing.
meanings.sent5: The gardener crenulated the hedge, giving it a unique appearance in the garden.
